website_summaries.verdict: The best choice of upgrade RAM. Well-suited for gaming computers or graphics workstations.
pros: Offers plenty of ram options all the way up to an individual 16GB stick
Different colors for exposed computer towers
cons: Upgrade is overkill for daily computing tasks like internet surfing

customer_reviews.title: I was able to get this memory to clock at ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this memory to clock at 3000mhz on my Ryzen 7 1700 on a Gigabyte Aorus Gaming 5 motherboard. It is on the approved list for this motherboard and I just used an XMP profile and have done many stress tests with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now compatible with Gigabyte AB350-Gaming 3
customer_reviews.text: Price was hard to swallow when I ordered back in June, and it's only risen further since then. Alas, that's how it goes if you need DDR4 in 2017. Bought this to go in a Ryzen rig with the nearly ubiquitous Gigabyte AB350 Gaming 3. I was initially dismayed to find the board wouldn't POST with this RAM running above 2133 MHz. However, the most recent BIOS update (as of September) has fixed the issue. Now running at 2933 MHz, which corresponds to a decent performance boost. If you're having compatibility issues on Ryzen, make sure to try flashing the newest BIOS.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my Ryzen 5 rig
customer_reviews.text: I have this memory paired with a Ryzen 5 2600X processor on a Gigabyte B450 Aorus Elite Motherboard. I had to set the memory XMP to Profile 1 to get the RAM to be used at full speed, but other than that, these three play well together with out any fiddling. I do not overclock, I use my computer for daily work and prefer low fan noise and stability over speed. If you are a gamer, you probably want to look at a different Motherboard. The Gigabyte MB is not the greatest for gaming but it has more port and other things I needed for my work, thus my choice there.
customer_reviews.author: Waslost1

customer_reviews.title: took it into a tech and found out 1/2 rams were bad. called support to replace 1/2 and they refused
customer_reviews.text: almost 7 months later my pc blue screened and crashed. took it into a tech and found out 1/2 rams were bad. called support to replace 1/2 and they refused. only way to get replacement was to send both back even though 1 was good. as a developer i can't have no working pc at home while i wait for the replacement... i would have to pay in advance for a dual set for them to send to me..verify it is good and then hope to get my double payment returned... so bull.... i think i will avoid corsair or "dual packs" again...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For me personally this was a great buy, that added exponentially to my system. I purchased 16gb twice. Didn't realize for awhile that I needed to turn on XMP to get the 3,000 mhz. Running smooth and fast thanks. Edit / Update important FYI if you're running a Ryzen 5 2600 and encounter instability after turning on XMP I recommend manually setting the ram speed to 2933. If you look up ryzen 5 2600 compatibility on ram speed goes up to 2933. Anything after and it may he unstable.
customer_reviews.author: iCkEdMeL

customer_reviews.title: Great for most builds.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great RAM offering from Corsair, and an be used in a multitude of builds This was my first foray into DDR4, I have been in DDR3 for the last few years and decided for an upgrade. I paired it with a AMD Ryzen 2700X and ROG Strix x470 board. It took some tinkering to get the board to run the RAM at its advertised speed, but once I figured it out it went well. Nothing flashy to see here, simple ram with a decent heat spreader.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyZ

customer_reviews.title: This RAM is QVL'd to work with AMD Ryzen processors, and DRAM prices are insane.
customer_reviews.text: It's DDR4 RAM. I paired it with a Ryzen R5 1500X and an Asus ROG Strix B350-F motherboard, updated the BIOS, and had no problem hitting the rated speeds. It's simple, clean, no flashy RGB madness. Currently running it at 2933MHz and 1.2v with zero issues (seemed silly to up the voltage to 1.35v just to get another 67MHz). Paid $189, and it made me cry to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Tango-Charlie

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: Memory sticks are always something that requires careful research to ensure CPU & chipset (motherboard) compatibility. Then careful handling & proper placement IAW the motherboard user guide. These sticks are working fine after over a month of regular daily-cycled use - probably around 200 hrs. I'm not an overclocker or even much of a gamer, so I can't really speak to their performance at the edge, but I have no reason to doubt the manufacturer's specs. Arrived in undamaged packaging and on time.
customer_reviews.author: aprimeclient

customer_reviews.title: WORKS with AMD Ryzen 5
customer_reviews.text: Decent price for the specs and brand-name. Most importantly, this RAM does work with the AMD Ryzen series which is known to be difficult in accepting RAM for whatever reason. If you are planning a Ryzen based build, unless something changes, ensure you ONLY purchase RAM that is explicitly tested to work with the Ryzen series and this RAM is one of your current options. Similarly, if you have a Ryzen series build that is, after standard troubleshooting, infinitely rebooting without posting a BIOS screen - you should look into your RAM being the source of your problem (this was my issue).
customer_reviews.author: R. Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Please sir, can I have some more ram?
customer_reviews.text: Placed these suckers in a ASRock X570 PRO4 AM4 AMD X570 SATA 6Gb/s ATX AMD Motherboard with a AMD RYZEN 5 3600 6-Core 3.6 GHz (4.2 GHz Max Boost) Socket AM4 65W Processor and it works like a charm. Sadly, mine didn't come with free block of woods like other reviewers /s. Mine came working with the motherboard without the hassle of updating bios. Didn't OC it yet but working as intended right out of the box. Hassle Free. Value 5/5 ***** Ease of Installation 5/5 ***** For Gaming 5/5 ***** My Recommendation 5/5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Memtest on this RAM now shows over 10,000 errors
customer_reviews.text: After barely 2 months of use with no overclocking, running Memtest on this RAM shows over 10,000 errors. So many errors that the test cannot be fully completed and halts at 71%. Trying to run a game while using this RAM results in a crash to blue screen after 10-15 minutes every time. And of course, this started happening just after the return window closed. Very very disappointed. After many years of buying nothing but Corsair memory, this is the first bad batch I've ever received. Probably will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Updated my machine, bought 16gb, then 16gb more!
customer_reviews.text: Had serious problems with my old setup that Ive had for a decade, crashes and rebooted on it's own.. Bought an Asus motherboard and Ryzen 5 CPU.. Ordered 16gb (2x8gb) as a start up. Ran that for two weeks then ordered 16gb (2x8gb) more for a fully populated motherboard of 32gb ram. I do photo editing with Affinity Photo and video editing with Magix, system is running very smooth and Im very happy. Im not a power gamer so I cant comment on that aspect. But for power applications the ram seams to be doing fine.
customer_reviews.author: Program4Food

customer_reviews.title: Could not reach the advertised speed of CL15... Was always switching to CL16 on Asus Prime X570-P
customer_reviews.text: I bought that kit because it is recommended everywhere.... Though, i could not even reach the advertised speed of CL15 on an Asus Prime X570-P with Ryzen 5 3600. Bad kit, bad luck, bad motherboard, bad BIOS? I don't know exactly but my guess is the mobo is not comptable with odd CL# timings... I don't want to blame a well known, highly praised memory kit, but this was my experience... PS: I've built 100s of PCs, i know what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephane Olivero

customer_reviews.title: So many defective Units. It's Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought FOUR different types of vengeance lpx ram from Amazon and a different retailer and so far only one pair has not failed any memory tests and has been stable in my computer. I really don't know how so many units of corsiar ram can be this defective. It's like they don't test them at all. I have just requested another replacement from Amazon and hopefully this one will work. I'm never going to buy any RAM from Corsair ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: No adjustments "required".
customer_reviews.text: You can simply put the memory in a good motherboard and go with it. The motherboard (a good one) will see the ratings and adjust the clocks accordingly and the memory will perform to its specs nicely! Sure, there is higher end memory available, however, it comes at a greater price. The question is what can you live within the speed of performance, are the ratings here good enough for what you want/need to do? If so, then you have the right memory selected. It is money well spent. I ordered one set on initial order but will be ordering a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Cordle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Well-made, Reasonably Priced!
customer_reviews.text: The CV Ram is pretty much a no-brainer purchase at this point. You can find tons of reviews online which go into the specifics of why. The point here is, this RAM works great, and my performance based on benchmark tests are very good. If you want some no-frills quality sticks, this is the way to go. I have enough RGB lighting in my rig, I don't need my RAM to light up as well, so I am happy not having to pay for that feature.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this RAM for around $50 on black friday and thought that this was pretty good price for what i was getting. the RAM feels nice and premium and i had no issues installing. 1 thing i should add is that if you are buying this for gaming or overclocking, it wont reach 3000MHz (at least for me). I am using a ryzen 7 2700 and was a bit short of overclocking this to 3000 MHz. If I could, I would got with either 3200 MHz or 3600 MHz if you multitask to help your Ryzen CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Great memory, a little pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Corsair Vengeance has been my go-to memory choice for the last ten years. As usual this set did not disappoint, works perfectly at advertised speed and timings. My new Gigabyte board instantly recognized them and OCed to 3000Mhz, no fuss. After about 50+ hours of gaming between the new Tomb Raider and AC at max settings I have had ZERO memory issues. My only complaints is that they seem a bit pricey when not on sale. I picked them up for ~$100 around Xmas, but at full price I think they are a bit high. But then again the last time I bought new memory was 3 or 4 years ago so I could be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: thought I was good. However
customer_reviews.text: Had issues at first with my Ryzen 1600 and ASUS Prime A320M-K. It wouldn't run anything other than the default 2133mHz. This memory was NOT listed in the ASUS compatibility chart, but I didn't even know that was a thing to check... MB was 3000mHz, RAM was 3000mHz, thought I was good. However, before I panicked or raged out, updating the BIOS from its own utility, enabled the RAM to run at the sticker 3000mHz. So no issues now!
customer_reviews.author: SaraB

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal quality control
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 2x8GB kit of DDR4 3000 CL15 to match my existing 2x8GB kit, this new kit does not run at DDR4 3000 in tandem with the older set (they have exact same timings, they must be using cheaper memory chips now).It is barely stable at 2666, and still causes frequent failure to boot even at 2133, requiring me to reset the bios many times before it starts working again. Corsair's quality control looks like it has gone down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: With Motherboard and Processors this RAM kicks butt
customer_reviews.text: So many features and options here. Breathed new life into my case. Feel like i am onboard a rocket ship. Window 10 was able to accommodate a new mother board, processor, RAM with out the need for a reinstall. First time ever for that i did have to reactivate my OS but other than that everything is cruising along. True USB 3.1 through out is making all my video and data projects happen with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Dog and Pony

customer_reviews.title: Great for just about everything.
customer_reviews.text: I used 16GB of RAM for heavy video editing for a year straight and it was great. I recently did a project where I was editing almost 400GB of footage and it still held up. It did slow down a tad though, so I upgraded to 32GB. I didn't need to, but I did. I don't game too much, but when I do it is amazing for that too. For a cheap price, it has great performance
customer_reviews.author: Brantopias

customer_reviews.title: QC is a hit or miss and god forbid if you have to contact customer support for questions.
customer_reviews.text: I sent my first pair of ram sticks back because I was having some extreme memory errors with windows memory tool and the good ol BSOD. Upon getting my second set, all my problems are now gone. If you happen to get the opportunity to speak with Corsair's customer support, I'm sorry. Their customer support is probably the worst in America, and Im looking at you Comcast. Took more than 3 hours of my time trying to find a solution to my problem only for them to just hang up on me because their methods weren't working. If you happen to get bad memory, definitely send it back and try again, the product is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It's Corsair, they know how to make ram !
customer_reviews.text: Reading other reviews you tell there have been some defective products and issues with customer service. I can't vouch on their CS since I have never had an issue with my Corsair products (be it ram or kb or mouse) and defects in the electronics happen in ANY brand. As long as you keep that mind, there should be no major issue or such ordering this line of RAM from Corsair. Have always used Corsair RAM since my early 2000s days of PC rig building and have YET to ever have an issue with their products. It OC's perfectly fine and no heating issues !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Got this set for a budget WFH build and it worked right out of the box with a Ryzen 3 3200G. My biggest concern was compatability with the CPU and/or mobo and it booted in dual channel mode on an ASRock B450m Pro4 no problem; XMP profile works great as well. I'd highly recommend this for a more budget friendly ram option or if you don't care for RGB, it's no frills and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fast, especially in dual channel for a Ryzen APU
customer_reviews.text: Great RAM. Benchmarks better than expected. I'm actually able to mildly overclock this memory, but that's not my style, so I'm running it at 3000MHz on an Asus Tuf 450 board. If you're not a gamer obsessed with getting the highest performance possible, this leaves nothing to be desired. If you *are* a gamer, you shouldn't be looking at budget gear like this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGill

customer_reviews.title: Overclocked, Stable, Cheap. What more do you want besides RGB?
customer_reviews.text: I bought the C15 3000mhz kit. XMP profile runs 1.35v at 15-17-17-35. I overclocked mine to 3200 14-16-16-30 at 1.38 and it's rock solid. I could probably go higher, but no real need to, so I haven't tried. If you don't need RGB, and let's be honest, who 'needs' RGB, this is the kit to get. It's low profile and fits any cooler worth putting in your system. I have had mine for over a year running daily like a champ with zero issues. I recommend setting your XMP profile and establishing your CPU overclock first, before attempting to OC the ram.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Best value for price - had a small issue at first.
customer_reviews.text: I originally almost returned these because I couldn't get them set up right in my BIOS. I had them in the correct Lane but the speeds were very low and I couldn't change it for some reason - basically I put them in the wrong lanes restarted, and then put them back in the correct lanes and entered the BIOS and I could work with them! Best value for the price and very low profile. If you have problems with OC try what I did, they've worked great since
customer_reviews.author: Swainkt

customer_reviews.title: Great product, awful customer/seller support
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have ZERO ISSUE with this product, but my Amazon account got hacked and this was FRAUDULENTLY returned and the seller lost money with no compensation from Amazon. I feel horrible for the seller so I am deducting stars overall because of the way Amazon handled this following me reporting the fraud. The product itself is wonderful, DDR4 is definitely the future. The POST is lightning fast. 100% worth the upgrade to a new machine and fresh ram. I have not had any performance issues at all. This is seriously the best RAM I’ve ever bought and I’d recommend it to anyone looking to make a new build and leaving DDR3 in the dust like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Marlena

customer_reviews.title: Works. But only at base speed of 2166.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't achieve XMP speeds of 3000 on MSI 390APro. Ram is listed on mobo website as compatible. Can't get it above 2200. I got my processor to 5 ghz without even going over 40 C. But this RAM won't go. Even tried setting the timings and voltage manually. Dissatisfied and it's past the return date now and I'm stuck. Maybe I can use it in another older PC for an upgrade?
customer_reviews.author: JG3

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, easy to install, no issues. Price is low and helps for daily tasks the use lots of ram like google chrome and gaming servers ;)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Amira

customer_reviews.title: won't work with MSI B450m and Ryzen 2400g
customer_reviews.text: Assembled a new system based on a Ryzen 2400g. Went together pretty smooth. Windows installed quick. All seemed well...then...BSOD's with memory management bsod's up the wazoo. Played with drivers...no dice. Replaced NVME ssd with regular ssd...no dice. Then I swapped it out with a different set of dimms. Success. Maybe it was the wrong ram for my board (even though MSI's configs say otherwise). Maybe it was bad??? Bottom line...didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price and clocked right in at listed speed
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about RAM - snapped into the DIMM slots and fired right up. Needed to tweak some UEFI settings to get it to run at full speed (3000 MHz) but that was easy and so far no stability issues. Not flashy - no exaggerated or exotic looking heat spreaders or ridiculous RGB, but gets the job done. Can't beat the price for 16 GB of RAM.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Easily worked with my MSI Z370 Type-A motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Easily worked with my MSI Z370 Type-A motherboard and a 8600K processor. XMP profile was rock solid stable. Managed to lower my System Agent and IO Voltage to 1.05v! Still running stable! P95 blend tested overnight approved!
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Running at 3000 on AsRock Steel Legent B450M
customer_reviews.text: All I did was set the the BIOS to grab the XMP information from the memory chips to set the speed. Worked perfect. The only concern is my 2600X chip runs really hot when under load. Might have to get a better cooler. Fortunately, I don't put my system under stress too often, not a gamer. According to CPU-Z, my modules have Hynix chips, which are supposedly not as compatible, but mine works good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reinholz

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but dies in 10 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: Put it in my pc was working great. I got on fortnite and was crashing a lot i was thinking it was maybe because my system was getting used to it. I was like “no big deal” but then i got on warzone the game was running better than it ever had and then my entire system crashed. Wouldn’t boot back up so I switched the ram. Boots perfectly with the old 8gb 3000mhz ram. I put the corsair back in and it gives me system 32 errors. I ordered a replacement. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: 2nd set didn't overclock
customer_reviews.text: So, i have bought 2 sets of these. My first set is hmming with xmp profile at 3200mhz. the ones I got today, wont go above 3000mhz.. like it wont even post. Kinda pissed that their chips changed. now im running 32gb at 3000mhz but its got tighter timing at least at c15.. im gonna try different timings now and see if i can squeeze anything out of this pair of sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Usman Sheikh

customer_reviews.title: is great i make overclock to 3400mhz
customer_reviews.text: Hi first i have a mobo B450M Bazooka MSI with ryzen 2600 a simple micro atx that have capability for overclock, i make overclock to 3400mhz and increase the speed very good and i stay it is satisfactory, no problem to install only problem for the overclock but you need to put the timings in 15-17-17-35 and works for me, i gain a lot of speed only for increase the hz
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Works with RYZEN!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should with my Ryzen 5 system. A lot of people were saying that it's very unstable to get RAM compatible with Ryzen, but this worked. I am able to run it at 2993 mhz. Although it did take some tweaking and the BIOS are a pain in my behind, I was able to get it after some Youtube tutorials. Would buy these again if I ever need to upgrade to more RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Adil Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Several bad sets lately, one was a block of wood.
customer_reviews.text: After years of trusting the Vengeance line, I'm moving on. I've had 4 in a row now that had one of the two sticks bad. I've updated motherboard in single-channel mode, done everything I can think of, and everything I've researched, but it all comes down to apparent bad QC. So much so that the last one I ordered was literally a block of wood inside the Corsair box. Ridiculous. But, that one is very likely not on Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: WayneOtis

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging - read first, don't skip.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so when I got the ram, the outside looked fine. The box that it was in looked nice, unopened, etc. When I took out the plastic container that encases the ram, I saw that part of the plastic had been torn. When I took the ram out, I found tiny plastic pieces inside the ram so obviously I returned it and a replacement is to arrive in 2 days. I will test the ram then and give y'all an update soon. Edit 1: Got the replacement long ago, totally forgot to update this comment. Its fast ram, perfect for ryzen 2nd gen. Re-rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Not for Ryzen 3000
customer_reviews.text: This memory has big issues with Ryzen 3000 both on the MSI B450 Tomahawk and MSI X570-A Pro boards. Refuses to post almost ever with XMP on and even with XMP off it still doesn't post occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Trailblazer15

customer_reviews.title: Good, if configured properly
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from 16, to 32GB in my overclocked (4.5GHz daily) i7 5930K PC, now in Quad Channel mode. MB: x99 Taichi For overclockers: I was having instability, until I realized that that I must also bump CPU cache voltage when adding more memory. Once cache power was raised from from 1.1 to 1.22v, all my issues disappeared. RAM performance matches, or exceeds advertised spec. Probably best bang for buck at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna

customer_reviews.title: cant be overclocked
customer_reviews.text: max clock speed is 2133Mhz, XMP wont even let me change any values for this memory Using an Asrock B450M Steel Legend (tested with uefi bios 2.10, 2.13a, 2.30, 2.50) They are installed in A2 and B2, they work normal and pass memtest86 but run at the lowest speed. mine came with Samsung chips (some are Hynix)
customer_reviews.author: Thierry

customer_reviews.title: Great quality great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dram kit... so good I have a indenticle pair of these exact moduals in all three of my main systems as they easily run at spec with xmp on both ryzen and Intel and maintain there low latency as advertised(huge performance factor for amd chips)...and there is some overclocking head room past xmp but it's not neccessary at 3000mhz
customer_reviews.author: theking8713

customer_reviews.title: Wont run at reported speeds
customer_reviews.text: I have a Rog Strix X470-F Gaming board that supports 3600mhz ram. Setting this ram to 3000mhz results in major fails. Can't even boot. Setting the speed to auto and it slows down to around 2100mhz but works fine. I returned both the board and the memory for the same and still go the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Linan

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these 2 years apart. The first set was great, worked out of the box, smooth. Then I decided to upgrade and buy one more set 2 years later. My computer recognized the RAM and ran smoothly for daily activities, but anything that is intensive (mainly gaming) gets blue screen errors as the the new set is corrupted. So right now we're looking at 50/50. Since the computer recognizes it, it's "technically functional", so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amogh Belagodu

customer_reviews.title: Can't get this to run stable at 3000 MHz
customer_reviews.text: It could be an issue with one of my other components, but I don't know... everything else seems to run fine. Maybe I'm doing something wrong. Tried doing it manually and also tried using XMP on my motherboard. Either way, my computer kept crashing (without anything else overclocked). The base speed is more than enough for my needs, but I did pay extra to be able to easily get it to 3000, so it's a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great memory no issues good price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 of these and they work perfectly! Make sure you consult your motherboards manual to see the configuration needed. Some systems, like mine, had to be configured in bios to correctly use the other 2 sticks in bays 2 and 4. How I figured this out was it keep rebooting itself , once I got into bios and changed a few things , it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Ryzen. Able to get a small overclock.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Ryzen machine. I have a Ryzen 7 1700 overclocked to 3.9ghz on a ASUS Prime x370. I'm able to get 3066mhz on the 0902 Bios, even though the DOCP that it's approved for is 2933mhz. Nowadays I'd go for the 3200mhz version, but back when I bought this, the motherboards were still getting their firmware updates, and this was on the list of approved memory. End story, been working great since I bought it months ago. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch.tv/SwingPoynt

customer_reviews.title: 9 months and one stick is dead.
customer_reviews.text: RAM is not something you should have to worry about dying for no reason. Im now running off of one 8GB stick because the other one died. I usually ignore 1 star reviews but it seems I have had the same problem many of the other 1 star people have also had. Maybe most people wont have a dead card after less than a year but I'm pretty disappointed in corsair right now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Dont Use Amazon For Fragile Computer Parts.
customer_reviews.text: I got these cards for my first pc build along with a motherboard and they were both shot. One card FROZE my computer at the splash screen without fail, and the motherboard gave me a cpu light every other time I booted. Unfortunately it took me too long to build the pc and it is too late to get a refund. I went to microcenter and got new cards and board and they have been working great for a week or 2, so I know its these parts. Next time I get anything relatively expensive or fragile I wont be using amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value. The memory had some instability issues with ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value. The memory had some instability issues with my ASUS PRIME Z270-K when running the XMP Profile at advertised speeds. This would most likely be solved by increasing the voltage slightly, and after switching to auto mode which lowered the clock frequency to 2133 Mhz, the memories were perfectly stable. This could all just be a compatibility issue with the motherboard and the XMP Profile, but I didn't dig too deep into the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson

customer_reviews.title: Great RAM from reputable brand
customer_reviews.text: Been a fan of Corsair Vengeance RAM since I started using them in my laptops in the very early DDR3 days. 3000MHz, paired with Ryzen 7 2700X and OC to 3200MHz with no issues (yes I know it is marketed to Intel cpu but works flawlessly with AMD Ryzen). Still recommend this RAM to friends and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Austin W.

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade for dual channel RAM performance
customer_reviews.text: This set of 2x8GB RAM sticks are rated at up to 3000Mhz 15-17-17-35 1.35 volts as shown on the label. This was a replacement for my single 16GB RAM stick. By using a matched set of RAM in dual channel mode, the computer's performance was improved by 10-15% during benchmark testing. They worked perfectly in my Intel i7-6700 processor motherboard which uses 2133Mhz RAM. So this proved to me that you can use faster spec'ed RAM in slower Mhz rated motherboards.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Higgins

customer_reviews.title: They work perfect with AMD Ryzen
customer_reviews.text: Despite the problems I had in the past to work properly with the AMD Ryzen CPU, nowadays it works perfectly. If you enable the XMP profile you can have the memory at 2933Mhz or if you want to work at 3000Mhz that supports the memory you can enter the values manually in the BIOS, of course you must also have the BIOS updated with AGESA support for greater memory compatibility and work with dual channel.
customer_reviews.author: Korbmann

customer_reviews.title: Solid at overclocking (will show at 2133 without xmp)
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of testing (xmp and manual overclocking) it's a decent set of RAM. It never gets too hot (even without waterblock/fan) and it's stable as anything I've ever used. I have a gigabyte aorus z390 ultra with 4 8gb sticks on xmp profile running max RAM on 16 16 16 34. Great set for a great price. Recommend for any size build unless you want fancy rgb ram...
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Smith

customer_reviews.title: Dropped to 4star due to DOA inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: Have only ever used Vengeance in all my PC builds and this was the first set I got that was bad. they worked but gave off thousands of errors and caused many windows crashes. Forced to purchase at best buy (Couldnt wait for replacement) and return these which was hassle free thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney H

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a piece of wood in the box
customer_reviews.text: There was no memory in the box when received. This only thing in the box was a thing piece of wood. What kind of quality assurance is happening within Corsair and Amazon. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good for a month then bsod's
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but all memory is expensive now. Works great! UPDATE: 5-31-18 After a month I started experiencing many crashes and bsods during my video editing and rendering of projects. Couldn't figure out what the problem was until I ran a couple of memory tests with memtest and Windows memory Diagnostic test. Both turned up tons of errors. In the process of returning to Corsair for warranty exchange.
customer_reviews.author: jmzfilms

customer_reviews.title: Solid memory at a good price, 3000 MHZ
customer_reviews.text: This memory addresses many of the memory bandwidth problems associated with an AMD Ryzen built as it runs at 3000 MHZ. Solid stable memory that allows for mild overclocking and solid stability. Ensure you purchase 2900 MHZ and over memory for AMD based system running Ryzen processors. Update BIOS on your motherboards to ensure compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Julio PTop Contributor: Metal Detecting

customer_reviews.title: Corsair always stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.text: These memory sticks are excellent value at a good price. I run everything including games off of these with no problems. I am using only 16gig now but will probably buy another pair in the future. Corsair always helped me with any of the products I have bought over the last 15 (?)years. They even replaced my old flash drive with a better one!
customer_reviews.author: Garrock

customer_reviews.title: Great product but confused on the MHz advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product but confused on the MHz advertised while the ryzen systems using XMP only max at clocks of 2933MHz rather than the full potential of the advertised ram speed of 3000MHz without over clocking the ram. I am unsure if this is a motherboard issue in general or a ram issue. I hope it get's fixed soon if it's an issue in either products
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: No problems with my RAM for the couple years I've had them. I highly recommend 16GB as a starting point for nearly everyone in a computer as you can see vast improvements over just half that. For the price point, RAM is a great way to speed up your computer. SSD being the best overall.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mantek

customer_reviews.title: Great value for DDR4 memory
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packages for 4 memory dimms, 32GB total. Works perfectly and all show up in my system, no errors. What more can be said about memory? I did not need anything fancy or RGB lighting. It works and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: One of the sticks came DoA out of the box... The other works great!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is expected to do. Great speeds and a low profile design... Sadly one of the memory sticks doesn't work right out of the box. I didn't won the lottery with this one. Out of the box one of the sticks doesn't work. I've tried putting it on other RAM slots but the PC won't even boot up. The other one works great on the other slots so I know it's not the motherboard. Tried booting it with both of them on and the PC just freezes after a minute of use.
customer_reviews.author: RoberttheBear

customer_reviews.title: BSOD machine
customer_reviews.text: I plugged these 2 8gb sticks of ram into my pc and at first they worked fine but after a few days I started getting BSOD's nonstop I ended up trying to re-install windows because I couldn't even reset my pc only when the re-installation of windows failed did I try taking out the RAM my computer instantly started working again and I haven't had a problem since I would recommend buying some better RAM and just avoid this entirely from the other reviews I've seen this isn't an uncommon issue so just save your time and money by buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This ram is awesome! Its fast and well made! The pricing was better then other sites and with Prime it was faster to get to me to double the RAM in my PC. Happy that these kinds of quality products can be purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BrenB84

customer_reviews.title: Mix and Match
customer_reviews.text: These sticks worked just fine. BUT I ordered them to increase my onboard ram from 2x8gb to 4x8gb. The 2 new sticks were advertised as identical to the 1 year old sticks I already had installed in my AMD system but had different version #s. They would not play nice together. The new sticks as well as the old sticks worked fine separately but not together. Buy them all at once and get a matched set and you avoid compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: David Parker

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: You push it into the motherboard after opening the retention clips. It just works. I paired it with a Ryzen 5 3600 and it has a negligible decrease in performance, as Ryzen prefers higher-speed RAM. Simple and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great RAM! Make sure your Bios is up to date!
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed this RAM, my pc wouldn't boot. I had a mini freakout. Bottom line is had to update my bios in order to use this RAM. After all said and done, this works amazing! Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiju

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly matches  Ryzen CPUs
customer_reviews.text: I have used this line of RAM on different AMD Ryzen builds and not a single problem. Make sure to check your BIOS settings and adjust the correct RAM speed, otherwise, the BIOS will default to 2133MHz. And always make sure you have the latest BIOS version. Other than that, I highly recommend this RAM.
customer_reviews.author: R4LDZ ✅

customer_reviews.title: we all know these are some really nice RAM sticks.
customer_reviews.text: These things work great, threw them in my computer and now I have more RAM. Good stuff, very good stuff Imagine everybody realizes these are great quality I figure I'll put a review anyway
customer_reviews.author: daniel  caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: If you have a b450 board I would suggest installing the ram into slot 2 and 4 for best performance, if you have the Ryzen 5 2400G, my motherboard suggested this AsRock B450 pro-4, will be getting another set to max my system out at 32GB
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Memory Sticks and the look good
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs and a fair price. I expect nothing less from Corsair and I'm not disappointed. I didn't need memory with 6,000,000 colored lights etc. (I have that light show on my other computer), so I'm please that the memory just works, and these are very solid sticks. Recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on this memory now
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't pass up buying another 16gb of this to match the 16gb I already had being the price has come down a lot in the past year. A year into a new build and it's been running great with no issues. Name brand, nice price and the usual fast Amazon service.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Agnello

customer_reviews.title: Solid RAM
customer_reviews.text: These are some pretty good sticks of RAM and 16GB is more than enough for most users for the foreseeable future. When first installed, they run at a lower frequency (1666 or 2133MHz), but all RAM does this. To get full use out of these, you'll need to change their settings through the BIOS. To do this, check the documentation/manual that came with your motherboard. With the current prices of RAM (8/21/2019), these are a pretty good deal. You might even want to consider upgrading to the 3200MHz C16 version if its within your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lubbert

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale, so the value for money was out of this world. It dropped right into my motherboard and has definitely boosted my multitasking and gaming performance over the 8GB of RAM my computer shipped with. It's a pretty no-brainer upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Work's as intended
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my ryzen 5 3800x, I had bought another set of these on another site about 2 years ago and they still work very well, just wanted a bit more RAM in my system. They are nice and compact so the should have good clearance for any cooling setups you might have, and I love the simple/sleek design.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Faulty RAM, failed after 3 months but Warranty replaced product quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Enabled XMP Profile, less than a month later RAM begins to malfunction. Ran MemTest and got over 6000 errors. Hoping the warranty comes through and the sticks are replaced Edit: So warranty covered the faulty ram and the manufacturer quickly replaced my RAM sticks. All is well, recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, and it hasn't given me any issues. UPDATE: After using this memory for three months my PC stopped booting. After much troubleshooting, I discovered it just doesn't work at 3000GHz. And this on a motherboard it is certified on, an ASUS Tuf Z270. Any speed below 3000GHz, and it works fine. UPDATE 2: After another BIOS update this memory works flawlessly at 3000GHz. So the issue was with the motherboard. This is excellent memory.
customer_reviews.author: LOTRouter

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I have four 8GB sticks of this in my Ryzen build. They've been running great at 3266 Mhz for 6 months now. The board is an MSI X470 Gaming Plus with a Ryzen 2700. No problems whatsoever, and the overclocked through BIOS very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Ooohhh Yesss!
customer_reviews.text: Well I built my first pc, 16gb may have been a bit too much but hey! My Gaming PC is set! I may need to get more so I can have my pc ready for other demanding software such as editing software. I am a graphic designer with minor photo/and video editing and the more RAM the better!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Corsair Stands Behind Their Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pairs in 2018. Only had time to setup a system during lockdown (2020, in case there's another). One pair didn't work. Bought it in the US, but staying in Asia. Wrote Corsair. Got a prepaid shipping label to Taiwan. Called the courier. Got it back last week without spending a dime.
customer_reviews.author: IanSC

customer_reviews.title: good ram
customer_reviews.text: I like Corsair products & just purchased another 16GB of the same ram, however, asking Corsair about compatibility, I got 2 different stories, calling no issue, asking via Amazon, Corsair reached out responding with " we don't guarantee compatibility, but you can try"
customer_reviews.author: EGR

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play, as all things should be.
customer_reviews.text: This memory is fast, efficient, and easy to install. My CPU is somewhat bottlenecking this, as AMD processors are designed for 3200Mhz and above, but it is nonetheless a speedy kit. For it's price, nothing can compare. It goes right into your motherboard without issue. Only problem is that it's kinda ugly, but for this price range that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Ortmeier

customer_reviews.title: Great memory
customer_reviews.text: It worked right out of the box with no problems. I put it into a AsRock B450m pro. So if you have that board this memory works on it no problem and I was able to OC to 3k with no problems. When I get time later I am going to tighten the timings some more because it seems I can get better performance out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Nyrobie

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: The last RAM sticks I had were lemons and fried within a few years of use. I'm pretty gun shy with RAM sticks now, but so far these seem to work. I'm happy with the style and the fact they feel high quality. Had no problems since installing them and they run everything I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: This RAM is indeed rated for 3000 MHz speed, but...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure this is on the Ryzen approved RAM list. I can't get it to clock at 3000 MHz with any stability at all. The most I've been able to squeeze out of it is 2400 MHz, and even then it occasionally crashes a game. I should also mention that I'm running 32 GB of it in 4 sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good ram. It works and I've had no problems; the sticks seem well built. I personally don't think the numbers matter too much on RAM myself, but I can't say I've had problems with the quality of the sticks and the quantity of memory available. Its about the most comfortable I could reasonably ask for.
customer_reviews.author: C. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck DDR4 ram. Although with Ryzen chips emphasizing ram speeds more and more, if I were to purchase new ram right now as of 12/22/19 I would probably go with the higher speeds.
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: BSODs galore
customer_reviews.text: I simply could not get this to work on my system w/o crashing constantly, no matter what frequency I set it to. The BSOD msg was always "Memory management" and it was instantly fixed if I removed it.
customer_reviews.author: cyclobiz

customer_reviews.title: Good RAM got 2 of these for 32Gig
customer_reviews.text: I'm deduction one star because the first one had a bad chip. But return was very easy with amazon. Got the new ram the day after I asked for a replacement RAM. I have them running at 2133 MHZ not 3000 like the product details. I'm sure with a little overclocking I can get these ram sticks to 3000 MHz like the product details says.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl E McCadden

customer_reviews.title: Easy overclock
customer_reviews.text: Runs easily on my rig at 3Ghz, as advertised. Actually got three of these kits, but only one was with the Samsung B-die. The other two had Hynix A-die. But doesn't impact performance!
customer_reviews.author: mibo

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was cheaper like the good old days
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was cheaper like the good old days. Does what it does, running at 3000mhz as advertised with my AMD 2700x and Asus X470 Prime Pro motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, just make sure your mobo/CPU can use it.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing was wrong with this memory. I did not have XMP enabled or a mobo/CPU pair that could support 3000 MHz. This is my error. I am annoyed with PCPartPicker since it did inform me of that my mobo/CPU would not support 3000 MHz. If you're curious, the mobo defaulted to 2133 MHz, the lowest setting. That kind of sucks, but it should be a nice kit to have for future upgrades. Old Post: Installed the memory and BIOS reported 2133 MHz, not 3000 MHz.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: While I find it funny that 16GB of RAM costs $25 more than it did during my last build 5 years ago, this works great and runs stable at 3000MHz with my i5-7600k. Would easily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my boyfriends brother and he loved it. I’ll be honest I have no idea what exactly it does but he said he is now able to do a lot more with his computer. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Fast Memory
customer_reviews.text: This is fast memory. I switch pages, hit keys, move/copy information and it does it thing. Works very well with the ROG Strix B350-f and AMD Ryzen 5 2600 CPU. Have had the memory installed for a month now, with no gliches, The sticks just keep wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Relaxng

customer_reviews.title: Good RAM
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 5 months ago, and just bought another set to expand even more. I would recommend it as I've never had any issues with performance or defects using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

product_meta.title: Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 DRAM 3000MHz C15 Desktop Memory Kit - Black (CMK16GX4M2B3000C15)
product_meta.description: Color:Vengeance LPX Black| Capacity:16GB Kit (2x8GB)| Style:3000Mhz CL15| *:MemoryVengeance LPX memory is designed for high performance overclocking. The heat spreader is made of pure aluminum for faster heat dissipation, and the eight layer PCB helps manage heat and provides superior overclocking headroom. Each IC is individually screened for performance potential. The DDR4 form factor is optimized for the latest Intel 100 Series motherboards and offers higher frequencies, greater bandwidth, and lower power consumption than DDR3 modules. Vengeance LPX DDR4 modules are compatibility tested across 100 Series motherboards for reliably fast performance. There's XMP 2. 0 support for trouble free automatic overclocking. And, they're available in multiple colors to match your motherboard, your components, or just your style. Memory Configuration Dual / Quad Channel
feature_bullets: Designed for great looks; SPD Speed: 2133MHz
Compatibility: Intel 100 Series, Intel 200 Series, Intel 300 Series, Intel X299

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars39,304 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
